column4: I'm trying to run an erlang app with init.d script and someone told me I need to set the HOME enviorement varaible to make it work
iniside or outside of the init.d script?
because my script runs fine in the shell but not in the init.d script
and what is the error of the script?
I see examples like 'export HOME=/root' in other scripts and I don't understand what that means
I've tried using upstart job and I don't get any error
when I check the status I get working/stopped
can you explaine what it does?
its exporting the var HOME with the path of the current home
~/ is the command /alias for the home-directory of the current user
if you type cd ~/ in the shell you will go into your home-directory
aren't the init.d/upstart scripts run as root or sometime a user without home?
I think your suggestion works. When I type 'env - erl' gives an error but 'env - HOME="/home/user" erl' works
